entry.title: Feasibility of showing a popup warning in standard Fiori app F298 when changes made through custom.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In the standard Fiori app Manage Memo Record (F298), the Company Code field has an F4 help. We have a requirement where, after a certain time (for example, post 7 PM), whenever a user selects a value from the F4 help, a popup warning message should be displayed on the Fiori side.

Since this is a standard app, custom changes have been made in the backend odata services I would like to know:

What is the feasibility of implementing this?
 How can this be handled

Has anyone implemented a similar scenario where custom popup logic is triggered in a standard app?

Any guidance or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content:
@PraveenJelli : check note: 3634421 - Replication Flow - transferring data failed due to error with object - SAP Datasphere

To resolve this, investigate the job log in SM37, SLG1,DHCDCMON,DHADM and ST22 for similar errors to identify mismatched elements. You may need to restrict the source with known filters, correct the target table's data types in SAP Datasphere, recreate the Replication Flow, and mark the existing target table as final. Better to raise a support ticket as this not the right platform, please use the support team ðŸ˜€

entry.title: Re: How to use aggregated value of a Z Condition Type aut...
entry.content:
Hello Abul,

It's not possible to transfer the header value of ZPR1 to ZPMO by standard configuration. To achieve something close to this, you can use custom logic (BAdI for Alternative Calculation of Condition Amount) and set ZPMO's amount based on the value of ZPR1.

If you require ZPMO to also display a non zero rate (KBETR), then the implementation must calculate a rate using a defined base (for example, per 1 unit). Otherwise, you can map the aggregated header amount into the Condition Amount of ZPMO.

entry.title: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC â€“ Guidance needed (S/4HANA Cloud Public 2508)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are currently working on an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (release 2508, Colombia localization) project and have encountered an issue related to scope items availability:

During our Fit-to-Standard workshops and the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA), the following scope items were included in our functional package:

  • 1GB â€“ Asset Accounting with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 1GF â€“ Assets Under Construction with Group Ledger (IFRS)

  • 33M â€“ Revenue Recognition â€“ Sell from Stock (IFRS)

  • 3M4 â€“ Revenue Recognition â€“ Service Documents (IFRS)

  • BGC â€“ Fiori Analytical Apps for General Ledger

  • 2JB â€“ SAP Fiori Analytical Apps for Financial Accounting

  • 1GI â€“ General Ledger Allocation Cycle

However, when moving forward with the configuration in Central Business Configuration (CBC) and in Signavio Process Navigator, we noticed that these scope items are not available for selection.

This raises uncertainty on how to proceed, and we would like to ask the community for guidance:

  1. Have these scope items been officially retired in release 2508, and are their capabilities already integrated into other scope items (e.g., Universal Parallel Accounting, Universal Allocation, or Fiori analytical catalogs)?

  2. Is there any alternative procedure to enable them in CBC?

  3. If they have been replaced, what are the successor scope items or the best practice recommended to cover these functionalities in the project?

Our main goal is to ensure that the scope defined in DDA is properly reflected in CBC, without leaving functional gaps or including obsolete scope items.

Any guidance from the community (or SAP experts) on the best way forward would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance!

I must say I never use that feature since we can build dynamic budgets at employee level that roll up dynamically (hence capture everything correctly when an employee moves from one worksheet from another in terms of budget envelope and spent) while allowing executives or HR to exceed budget through executive review if they need to. I would rather keep the leading practice design I just explained and create a separate budget only for executives or HR (only visible by them) for them to make adjustments.

But I just looked into this feature and found this KBA:  https://me.sap.com/notes/2084180

 

Reporting on Overrides

There are a number of reports available to validate Variable Pay data. Go to: Admin Center> Compensation Home > Select correct plan > Plan Setup > Validation Reports.

 

I will try to turn it on later in my demo environment but maybe you can already look at this lead "Validation Reports".

 

Thanks

Xavier

entry.title: Re: Pros & Cons of using Stand-alone SLT vs Embedded SLT
entry.content:
2.3 Location of the SAP LT Replication Server System
Before beginning the installation, it is important to understand the various system landscape options:

  • We recommend installing SAP LT Replication Server as a separate system.
  • For ABAP-based SAP source systems, SAP LT Replication Server can also be used within the source system.
  • For ABAP-based SAP target systems (for example a Central Finance system), SAP LT Replication Server can also be used within the target system.

Installing the SAP LT Replication Server as a separate system is recommended for the following reasons:

  • It allows a clear separation of concerns - the SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server system will only replicate data and all system resources are dedicated to this.
  • It allows a different set of users to be the single users to have access to the system (security aspects).
  • It allows independent planning of upgrade cycles or other maintenance activities on the SAP Landscape Transformation Replication Server system. For example, this will avoid downtime in the Central Finance system if any maintenance activities need to be done in the SAP LT Replication Server system.
  • It supports the independent sizing of servers and allows you to manage performance efficiently.
  • It helps to keep an overview of the system landscape if multiple source systems are connected to one or more target systems.

Installing (and using) the SAP LT Replication Server in the source or target system is only recommended:

  • If there are so few replication use cases, that an additional system is too expensive (for example if you replicate data from
    one source system to SAP Central Finance and there are no plans to expand the scope of the scenario). 

You can find more details via the below link to SLT Installation Guide.

entry.title: Re: UI.SelectionVariant how to reference login user in fi...
entry.content:
@YOJAN 

Use CDS Declarative Authorization
1. First, define your entity with the createdBy field in your CDS model (schema.cds or service.cds):

cds
using { cuid, managed } from '@sap/cds/common';

entity Certificates : cuid, managed {
name : String(255);
description : String;
// createdBy and modifiedBy are automatically managed by 'managed' aspect
}
2. Create security annotations (security.cds or add to existing model):

cds
using { MyService } from './path-to-your-service';

annotate MyService.Certificates with @(
restrict:
);
3. For UI default filtering (optional), use this in your annotations.cds:

cds
annotate service MyService with @(
UI.SelectionVariant #MyCertificates: {
Text: 'My Own Certificates',
SelectOptions: [
{
PropertyName: 'createdBy',
Ranges: [
{
Sign: #I,
Option: #EQ,
Low: { $user.id } // Correct syntax for UI default
}
]
}
]
}
);
Key Points:
Security First: The @restrict annotation ensures server-side enforcement that cannot be bypassed

Automatic User Tracking: The managed aspect automatically populates createdBy and modifiedBy

UI Default: The $user.id in SelectionVariant provides a user-friendly default filter

Required Configuration:
In your package.json, ensure you have:

json
{
"cds": {
"requires": {
"auth": {
"kind": "xsuaa"
}
}
}
}

The @restrict annotation with $user is the canonical CAP way to implement user-specific data access and should always be your primary security mechanism.

entry.title: Re: Cant send EULAs via the place order app
entry.content:
As I checked , I can see your issue occurs in Sales & Marketing Card which belongs to SAP for Me Partner Dashboard.

Unfortunately, we here at SAP Support do not have relevant authorization to support SAP for Me Partner Dashboards or any of the related partner cards.

The authorizations required for Partner Dashboards are different than Customer Dashboards.

In order to get the full benefits of SAP for Me, ensure that you contact your Partner Security Manager/Partner user admin to provide you with the permissions you need for your specific role.

To get further help, please see this KBA for more info:

3165784 - How to get assistance for Partner Dashboards and the related partner cards - SAP for Me

Kind Regards

SAP Support

 

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection â€“ Whatâ€™s the Best Practice?
entry.content: it is mandatory. The full baseline scope is not a suggestion; it is the foundational, pre-configured solution designed by SAP. It represents a bundle of integrated best practices that ensure system integrity, stability, and upgradeability. Attempting to de-select parts of it is unsupported and will lead to the inconsistencies you are experiencing.

entry.title: Re: CBC Baseline Scopes vs. Manual Selection â€“ Whatâ€™s the Best Practice?
entry.content: Stop using JSON files for scope overwrites. The JSON import feature is causing your system to revert to the baseline as a protective measure to maintain a "clean core." The best practice is to use the system's built-in "Changes via Edit" function within the CBC UI for all scope modifications after the initial baseline activation.

entry.title: Re: Testing API call with in Ariba Developer and postman
entry.content: @isunsai you absolutely need an administrative action, but it must be performed in the Ariba Developer Portal, not the Ariba Supplier Portal. The 401 error is an authorization failure at the API gateway level, not a user permissions issue within your sourcing tenant.The primary reason for your 401 error is almost certainly that your application's request to use the "Supplier Data API" has not been formally approved, and the critical OAuth Secret has not been generated by a user with the Organization Admin role.

entry.title: Re: SAP Integration Suiteã®AI Adapterã®ä½¿ã„æ–¹ Vol2.åŸºæœ¬ç·¨
entry.content:
@rajeshps 
The final step is to output the log. I wrote the following Groovy script.

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import java.util.HashMap;

def Message processData(Message message)
{   
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String;
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);
    if(messageLog != null)
    {
        messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("log1",body,"text/plain");
    }
    return message;
}

We are trying to maintain some global parameter specified to receiver system alias that will be consumed in the step 7 iflow, instead of maintaining the same value and externalized the value in each iFlow . Thanks

Currently we are building our own script to read the parameter of the receiver system alias.

The proposed change below will work for our scenario.

def pid = (properties.get("pidToLookup")) ? properties.get("pidToLookup") : headers.get("partnerID")

Thanks again for your prompt response.

entry.title: Re: Suser Issiue
entry.content:
Hi Cigdem,

The issue arises because your S-user currently lacks the required authorization for the Cloud installation number 2132xxxx. As outlined in KBA 2598170, S-users must have the "Display Cloud Data" authorization at the Cloud installation number level, in addition to standard case authorizations, to view support cases for this installation. 

Typically, you would need to reach out to your administrator listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to have the authorization reassigned. More information about the authorization 'Display Cloud Data', pls refer to KBA 2598170 - What is the Display Cloud Data authorization? - SAP for Me

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us.

Have a nice day!

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Reassign Test Cases to Process in SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
One of the most common challenges in SAP Cloud ALM Test Management is ensuring that manual test cases are correctly linked to the right process. Until recently, if a test case was created without a process assignment, or with the wrong one, there was no straightforward way to fix it. You needed to delete it and recreate it.

With the latest update, SAP Cloud ALM now allows you to reassign a test case to the correct process.

When you reassign a test case:

  • All predefined activities related to the original process flow diagram are reclassified as custom activities.
  • Activities related to the new process flow diagram are automatically added to your structure.

This ensures the test case is properly aligned with the correct solution process while keeping any work you may have already done.

Why This Matters

In the blog about mass upload of test cases, I highlighted in a comment a limitation: during mass uploads using Excel, it is not possible to assign test cases directly to processes because we don't have a process ID.

This meant that after mass upload, test cases were orphans, without an assignment to a process. The new reassign functionality does not fully solve the gap in the mass upload, but it offers a practical way to correct process assignments afterwards. The bad part is that it needs to be done one by one.

To reassign a test case, open it and click Reassign in the up right corner.

 

This enhancement makes test management in SAP Cloud ALM more flexible and helps reduce the manual effort needed when test cases are assigned to the wrong process. Itâ€™s not necessary to recreate the test case for that. And it allows to assign the process to those test cases uploaded via Excel. But I still miss the possibility to upload the test cases in mass with the process ID, and avoid any effort related to reassignments.

Have you already tested this new functionality in your projects? How do you handle mass uploads and process assignments in Cloud ALM? Share your experience in the comments.

entry.title: Re: Default Purchasing Option in LMS
entry.content:
Hello @alper_kacar ,

The default purchasing option while creating new items is 'No Charge' and there are no changes made to this configuration. There are also no configuration in the system which affects this.

While scheduling/creating classes, the default purchasing option is set to 'Inherit item chargeback settings' which inherits the purchasing option set at item level.

So if you have some items without 'No Charge' purchasing option, you can change them to 'No Charge' and all the class related to the item will become 'No Charge' if purchasing option is set to 'Inherit item chargeback settings' at class level which is the default one.

In case this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

Swapnil

entry.title: Re: How to Add Standard Columns to the Learning Item Conn...
entry.content:
Hello @Meredith-Kiewit ,

You can use SUBJ_AREA_1/2/3 to add categories to item using connector.

If you want to know how you can update categories using item connector then below are the steps:

  1. Navigate to System Administration > Configuration >System Configuration > CONNECTOR
  2. Update the following Item Connector values:

item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_1=SUBJ_AREA_1
item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_2=SUBJ_AREA_2
item.field.mapping.data.SUBJ_AREA_3=SUBJ_AREA_3

  1. Place the file in SFTP server with header SUBJ_AREA_1 and category ID under the column to add and run the Item connector. You can use SUBJ_AREA_2 and SUBJ_AREA_3 to add two more categories at the same time.

Here is a KBA for your reference: https://me.sap.com/notes/2761490/E

 If this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

 Swapnil

entry.title: Re: Default Purchasing Option in LMS
entry.content:
@alper_kacar myaarpmedicare wrote:

Hi, items and classes we created in LMS always had the purchasing option "No Charge" until recently. But some users reported that the new items they created had another value than "No Charge" in purchasing options. Which created an issue with classes. We do not use any pricing in our system and users don"t want to change the purchasing option every time they create an item. According to this note "No Charge" is always the default option. (https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2376238 ) Are there any changes to this? Because we haven"t done any configuration that could affect purchasing options.

Hello @alper_kacar,
If "No Charge" was previously the default and now appears changed without any configuration updates, it may indicate a backend update or system patch affecting defaults. I recommend confirming with SAP Support whether any recent changes impacted purchasing option behavior, as per SAP Note 2376238.


Best Regards,
Kyla Ellis

entry.title: Re: "Item is in use and cannot be deleted"
entry.content:
Hello @user116 ,

The deletion of primary records (ex.: Items, classes, content objects, learners/user, domains, categories, curricula, locales, etc.) from Learning is discouraged and in many cases not possible through the front end of the application.

In most cases, the records cannot be deleted due to referential integrity constraints that have been built into the application: the primary records have interacted with other records in the database which has built a chain of relationships in the database structure.

This item could be used at multiple places in LMS, even if it has different revisions, substitute, pre-requisites, you will not be able to delete this item. 

You have 3 options to go around this:

  1. "INACTIVATE" the record as in most cases deletion of primary records is not supported in the system >
  2. When this option is unavailable, you may add 'Do Not Use' or a similar message of your choice to the record description and remove from catalog/library access >
  3. Contact our Professional Services team to have a script built to delete the entities.

For more information, refer this KBA:  2253851 - Unable to delete primary records in SAP SuccessFactors Learning - SAP for Me

If this information helped you then please consider giving Kudos or accepting this post as solution.

Swapnil

entry.title: Re: S/4 - Open Sales Order Report with Partialy Deliveries
entry.content:
Yes as you might be knowing, most of the standard sales order analytical cubes like I_SalesOrderItemCube are header/itemâ€“centric and do not join to the delivery item tables like LIKP/LIPS, or the goods movement data. Delivered quantity is stored in:

  • VBEP (schedule lines) â€“ confirmed and delivered quantities
  • LIPS â€“ actual delivery quantities
  • VBUK/VBUP â€“ delivery status flags (in S/4, it is LIKP / LIPS)

The standard cube doesnâ€™t bring these in because itâ€™s meant for order intake analysis, not fulfilment tracking.


Try with any of the below options

Identify the standard cube closest to your needs like I_SalesOrderItemCube. Create a Custom CDS View (type: Cube) that extends it with:

  • Join to I_SalesOrderScheduleLine (for confirmed/delivered qty)
  • Or join to I_DeliveryDocumentItem (for actual delivered qty)

Add a calculated measure for Open Quantity. Use this extended cube in your Custom Analytical Query. In Private Cloud, you can do this in the Custom CDS Views app without developer keys.

The other option is start from I_DeliveryDocumentItem (contains reference sales order/item and actual delivered qty). Join to I_SalesOrderItemBasic to bring in order qty and other sales attributes.

entry.title: Re: MMSC_MASS Missing LGORT Field
entry.content:
In your case, the LGORT is not showing could be because the MASS object for material master (BUS1001001 / MATERIAL) has field groups that control which key fields are available for selection. For the â€œExtend Storage Locationâ€ use case (MMSC_MASS), the key fields are Material and Plant by default. If the Storage Location field (LGORT) is not part of the key fields in the MASS object definition, you wonâ€™t see it in the initial selection screen â€” even though it exists in MARC/MARD.

This can happen if the MASS object was adjusted in customizing and LGORT was removed from the key fields. Youâ€™re using a variant of the MASS object thatâ€™s restricted to plantâ€‘level extension. In S/4HANA, some storageâ€‘locationâ€‘level data is only editable via MMSC (single) or via LSMW/BDC, not via MM17, unless the MASS object is enhanced.

So go to MASSOBJ, select Object type BUS1001001 or Material, go to Fields and check if LGORT is present and marked as a key field for the relevant table (MARD). If itâ€™s missing, add it back and transport the change.

Next check is go to OMS9, make sure LGORT is not hidden for the views youâ€™re trying to maintain. In S/4HANA, LGORT is an organizational level, not a â€œfieldâ€ in the usual sense; so it must be part of the key structure for the MASS object.

In MM17, choose Data Type = â€œStorage Location Data for Materialâ€ (MARD) instead of â€œPlant Dataâ€ (MARC). This will give you LGORT as part of the selection.

entry.title: Re: Stock in transit with moving average in SAP S4HANA
entry.content:
Yes in S/4HANA, it is quite possible to meet your requirement. As you rightly indicated, with 107, you can post an accounting document immediately at the PO price when ownership transfers at loading per Incoterms. Stock is held in Valuated GR Blocked Stock in the actual receiving plant. Itâ€™s on your books but not available for MRP or consumption. Moving Average Price (MAP) is not recalculated for unrestricted stock at this point, because the quantity is not yet in unrestricted use.

With 109, you can move the stock from GR Blocked to Unrestricted when the truck arrives. No accounting document is generated; itâ€™s purely a quantity movement. MAP is updated only once, based on the value already posted at 107.

Quick mapping for clarity (Public Edition):

  • F1639A â€“ My Purchase Requisitions â€“ New â†’ successor to the older Create Purchase Requisition (F1643) and My Purchase Requisitions (F1639).
  • Create Purchase Requisition â€“ Advanced â†’ the SAP GUI for HTML app based on ME51N (different app not F1639A). Availability/features differ from Manage Purchase Requisitions â€“ Professional (F2229). SAP Help Portal-Create Purchase Requisition - Advanced

entry.title: Re: How to connect and replicate custom tables from SAP B...
entry.content:
@kr_pavankumar 

To load data from BTP ABAP Tables to Datasphere efficiently, you need to use SQL service.

Follow below steps:

  1. If it is first time data replicating to DSP from BTP, I would recommend having a dedicated package for your developments.

Packages and TR's: It is not straight forward and are not same as S/4 HANA ABAP Developments.

Please check below link for more information on this.

You would need BTP Admin Access as well for initial setup.

BTP - Software Components

ABAP Cloud - Software Components and Relationships

2. Now after package and TR's sorted out.

In BTP, Firstly, Create Wrapper CDS views and mandatory you need to use annotation - "DataIntegration.deltaReplication.intended: true".

Secondly, Release CDS view with C1 Contract(Key User and Cloud).

Refer below link for code snippet:

DataIntegration.deltaReplication.intended | ABAP Keyword Documentation

3. This is one time, create a Service Definition for Wrapper CDs View created in step 2 - Give a Generic name as you will not create it again and again, you will just add Entities inside it for new requirements.

Also use statement - 'provider contracts sql' in your code. Refer Below Link for reference.

Creating a Service Definition and an SQL-Typed Service Binding | SAP Help Portal

4. This is one time, create a Service Binding of Binding type 'SQL â€“ Web API' for Created Service Definition in step 3, Give a Generic name for Service binding.

For option 'Enabled Operations' - check SELECT and REPLICATE.

Release Service Binding with C2 and C1 Contracts.

5. This is one time, Create Communication Scenario fist in Inbound Tab, add Inbound Service S_PRIVILEGED_SQL1. Second in Authorizations tab add Authorization Object S_SQL_VIEW and provide field values as mentioned in below reference link by SAP. Follow this link, should be straight forward.

Hint : Under SQL_SCHEMA = Provide Service Binding Name, SQL_VIEW = Provide * , SQL_VIEWOP = Select on Read and Replicate.

Once done, Click on Publish Locally.

Creating a Communication Scenario with Object Privileges | SAP Help Portal

6. Once Communication Scenario is built, From Developer Perspective it is done, Now from BTP Admin side 3 things needs to be done.

7. First BTP Admin, need to create Communication System and a Communication User.

8. Second, BTP Admin, need to create Communication Arrangement using Communication Scenario, Communication System and Communication User.

Link for reference:

Creating a Communication System and a Communication User | SAP Help Portal

Creating a Communication Arrangement for Exposing the SQL Service | SAP Help Portal

9. Now finally for Datasphere Replication, follow below link, it should be straight forward.

Creating a Replication Flow for SQL Service Exposure | SAP Help Portal

10. Last but not least, please check Prerequisites and Constraints.

Prerequisites and Constraints | SAP Help Portal

Let me know in case you get stuck anywhere. It is bit complex, but after above hint you should be able to figure out.

entry.title: Re: Scope items included in DDA but not available in CBC...
entry.content:
Hello @JuanseVal 

Many traditional scope items, especially those related to asset accounting with group ledger (IFRS) and other specialized analytics, have been officially retired or deprecated as of recent in the 2408/2508 releases. The 2508 â€œWhats Newâ€ document confirms that certain scope item are retired or no successor is planned.

Some scope items especially analytics-related ones are now covered through embedded standard CDS views or centralized analytics, making their selection unnecessary. So, items like BGC, 2JB may be replaced by embedded dashboards or KPI tiles that come standard or included in other scope items.

For Colombia localization which is country-specific, make sure that group ledger functionalities and analytics are now provided under universal parallel accounting and related finance scopes. You may need to activate these global scope items that replace local best-practice ones.

Regarding your question on alternative procedure to enable them in CBC, please note that once scope items are deprecated, you cannot enable them directly in CBC.

Check SAPâ€™s current Deprecated Scope Item lists (KBA 3488313, 3649879) to confirm if listed scope items are no longer available for configuration.

Here are some successor scope items that might be helpful to your course:

    • Universal Parallel Accounting and Universal Allocation are the modern finance architecture for all group valuations, parallel ledgers, and asset management.
    • Analytical apps are accessed through standard Fiori catalog or embedded CDS views; refer to SAP's analytics documentation for mapping classic analytical scope items to new solutions.
    • If key functionality appears â€œmissing,â€ validate whether itâ€™s present as part of a new universal scope item or a non-scope-dependent feature (such as standard Fiori apps) in CBC and process navigator.

If your clientâ€™s business processes require their functionality, ensure you activate successor scope items and standard apps using the CBCâ€™s scope and organizational structure phase to ensure analytics content is assigned to relevant Fiori catalogs.

To enable you to adhere to best practices, whilst you ensure that your Fit-to Standard scope aligns with CBC and no functionality gaps remain, I suggest you consider:

  • Check the officially deprecated scope item list,
  • look for successor scope items, map the functionality you require against what SAP delivered,
  • check localization-offerings and finally
  • consider engaging with SAP or local partners.

You can consult these references for more guidance.

  • SAP KBA 3488313: Official List of Deprecated Scope Items
  • SAP CBC Guidance on Deprecated Items
  • SAP Help Portal Feature Scope Description and What's New
  • Universal Parallel Accounting Overview
  • SAP Community Guidance â€“ Scope items in DDA but not in CBC

entry.title: How to Create a Decision Tree in BRF+
entry.content:
How to Create a Decision Tree in BRF+
1. Introduction

The Business Rule Framework Plus (BRF+) in SAP allows business users and developers to define and maintain business rules without extensive ABAP coding.
A Decision Tree is a graphical way of modeling conditional logic where each branch represents a decision point.

This manual explains how to create and test a Decision Tree in BRF+.

2. Launch BRF+ Workbench

Open SAP GUI.

Enter Transaction Code: BRF+ (or BRFPLUS).

The BRF+ Workbench opens in a browser-based window.

3. Create an Application

In the Workarea, select Create â†’ Application.

Enter details such as:

Application Name: Z_DEMO_APP

Description: Demo application for decision tree

Package: $TMP (for local) or assign to a transport request

Save the application.

4. Create a Function

Inside the application, right-click and choose Create â†’ Function.

Maintain the following:

Name: Z_DECISION_TREE_FUNC

Mode: Event Mode

Save the function.

5. Create a Decision Tree Object

Right-click on the function.

Select Create â†’ Expression â†’ Decision Tree.

Provide details:

Name: Z_DECISION_TREE

Description: Example for discount calculation

Save the object.

6. Define Input and Output Data Objects

Create input data objects for decision making, for example:

Order_Type (Data Type: CHAR)

Customer_Category (Data Type: CHAR)

Define an output object to hold the decision result, for example:

Discount_Value (Data Type: NUMC).

7. Model the Decision Tree Logic

Open the Decision Tree in the graphical editor.

Add branches and maintain conditions:

IF Order_Type = 'ONLINE' â†’ Assign Discount_Value = 10.

IF Order_Type = 'RETAIL' â†’ Assign Discount_Value = 5.

ELSE â†’ Assign Discount_Value = 0.

Save and activate the decision tree.

8. Test the Decision Tree

Right-click on the decision tree and choose Test.

Enter test values, for example:

Order_Type = ONLINE

Customer_Category = GOLD

Execute and verify the result returned in Discount_Value.

9. Conclusion

We have successfully created a Decision Tree in BRF+.
This object can now be used in business functions to replace hard-coded logic, making it easier to maintain and update rules without changing ABAP code.

For complex business rules, you may also explore Decision Tables or Formulas in BRF+.

The APP VT01N is not available in SAP Public Cloud. Please check details in KBA 3261640 - Usage of LE-TRA Route and discontinuation of Transportation features of LE-TRA in public cloud

The transportation features of LE-TRA, especially the shipment and the shipment cost document, including all necessary objects, Master data, customizing and transactions, are not released in the S/4HANA Public Cloud.
